abstract.p: Television ratings for US Open golf championship noted (S)

block.p: The third round of the United States Open on Saturday, during which Tiger Woods extended his lead to 10 strokes, produced a 6.5 overnight Nielsen rating on NBC. The rating was 23 percent higher than last year's third round.

NBC carried 11 hours 15 minutes of the national championship on Saturday in two segments. The first, from 9:30 to 11:30 a.m., the completion of the second round, rated a 4.4. The 6.5 rating for the second segment, which lasted from 1:30 to 10:45 p.m., equaled the third-round rating three years ago.

The third round of the United States Open on Saturday, during which Tiger Woods extended his lead to 10 strokes, produced a 6.5 overnight Nielsen rating on NBC. The rating was 23 percent higher than last year's third round.

NBC carried 11 hours 15 minutes of the national championship on Saturday in two segments. The first, from 9:30 to 11:30 a.m., the completion of the second round, rated a 4.4. The 6.5 rating for the second segment, which lasted from 1:30 to 10:45 p.m., equaled the third-round rating three years ago.
During the 8 to 10:45 p.m. period, a rare foray for a golf telecast into prime time, the tournament generated a 7.5 rating. Last year's third round was carried from 12:30 to 7 p.m.
